faq.question: Pourquoi convert SVG to raster if SVG scales infinitely?
faq.answer: Some applications require raster pourmats (JPEG, PNG) and don't Support SVG. Converting to high-Résolution raster ensures compatibility Tout en mIAntIAning Qualité.

faq.question: Quoi's the Meilleur Résolution pour converting SVG?
faq.answer: pour Web, 2x or 3x your display size. pour Impression, 300 DPI at your Impression dimensions. Our tool can help you determine the Optimal Résolution.

faq.question: Will I lose Qualité converting SVG to raster?
faq.answer: Converting to very high Résolution raster mIAntIAns excellent Qualité pour practical purposes. SVG's infinite scaling lets us Créer extremely detIAled raster Images.

faq.question: Can I Agrandir an existing raster SVG export?
faq.answer: If you have the original SVG file, it's Meilleur to re-export at higher Résolution. If you only have a raster export, our IA can Améliorer it further.

faq.question: Quoi pourmat should I convert SVG to?
faq.answer: PNG pour transparency Support, JPEG pour photographs, or WebP pour Web optimization. Choisir Basé sur your content and use case.

faq.question: Is AVIF Meilleur than WebP?
faq.answer: AVIF generally Fournit Meilleur Compression and Qualité than WebP, especially pour complex Images. Commentever, WebP has broader browser Support currently.

faq.question: Should I use AVIF or JPEG pour upscaling?
faq.answer: Use AVIF if your target audience uses modern browsers. JPEG is safer pour universal compatibility. Our IA works excellently avec both pourmats.

faq.question: Can I convert AVIF to other pourmats after upscaling?
faq.answer: Yes! After enhancing your AVIF Image, you can download it in JPEG, PNG, WebP, or keep it as AVIF Basé sur your needs.

faq.question: Quoi browsers Support AVIF?
faq.answer: AVIF is Supported in Chrome 85+, Firefox 93+, Safari 16+, and Edge. About 75% of users globally have AVIF Support.

faq.question: Is AVIF Prêt pour production use?
faq.answer: Yes, avec proper fallbacks. AVIF is production-Prêt pour modern Web applications, especially Quand pIAred avec JPEG or WebP fallbacks pour older browsers.
